alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing and expected to continue. * WHERE...Cherokee County. * WHEN...Until Noon CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Nearby roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 215 AM CDT, Emergency Management reported significant flooding along the Chattooga River along and near Hwy 68 in northeast Cherokee County. Nearby roads remain under water and impassable. Please avoid the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cedar Bluff, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Eastern Weiss Lake, Western Weiss Lake and Fullerton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
